alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 7:08AM EST until March 08 at 6:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties. Maumee River near Defiance affecting Henry and Defiance Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Williams, Defiance and Fulton OH Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maumee River near Defiance. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.3 feet, Flooding begins on Auglaize and East Front Streets and in the rear of the building at Leever Glass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM EST Monday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.7 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
